reviewText: I remember watching "Here's Lucy" many years ago. To me, there were too many guest stars and too many silly plot lines. Wow, this DVD set proves me wrong. Yes some of the guest stars do not connect (Ginger Rogers, Shelley Winter) and the plots are not always very good (Lucy at the Air Force Academy).What does connect is the relationship between Lucy and her twochildren. She is even willing to stay in the background and occasionally give the two kids the major roles in a few episodes. Lucie and Desi, Jr. are not especially talented, but Lucy clearly adores them and that makes her softer and less strident. Lucy is just as funny and more likeable that in "Here's Lucy." Gale Gordon is present, but in a greatly reduced role from the previous series.What really shines in this DVD set is the extras, with commentary from Lucie and Desi, Jr. and others as well as out takes and pre-taping scenes. Desi Arnaz makes a quick guest appearance. Gary Morton warms up the studio audience. Throughout the commentaries, Lucille Ball comes across as "mom," as well as a super star.  I hope the kids do volume two!
summary: Great Extras -- Better Series Than Remembered
Title: N/A

reviewText: I found this DVD at a locla record store yesterday. What a case of time travel! I remember that I would watch this right after "Gunsmoke" and right before my bedtime! I remember the episode of Lucy breaking her leg skiing airing around the time I started first grade in September 1971. Best of all, I remember what amounted to a comedy duel between Lucy and Flip Wilson (the latter playing Geraldine in "Gone With the Wind"-how's that for surreal?).Flip-I'm free! I'm free! I'm F-R-E!Lucy-You can't even spell! That's F-R-E-E!Flip-Look here, I'm free now ! I can spell it any way I want!And now to have all of this that was tucked into the corner of my memories back on DVD! As Karen Carpenter said, "It's Yesterday Once More."
summary: A Treasure of Childhood Memories
Title: N/A

reviewText: This is wonderful news and I am looking forward to buying this collection. Anything with "Lucy" is great, but frankly, one thing has me puzzled. Why hasn't Lucie Arnaz and Desi Arnaz Jr. thought about releasing "The Lucy Show", her 1960's sitcom on DVD? All we have is mediocre episodes on bad transfers with cuts on that series. Nothing official. And certainly nothing of the Black and White episodes of the first and best season of that series where Lucy and Viv were in full swing with their comedic talents. They played off each other beautifully and Lucy was in full command of her talents. There were many classic episodes in the first three years of that series....such as "Lucy and Viv put in a Shower", "Lucy and Viv put up a TV Antenna", etc. (Except for a handful of excellent episodes you can have seasons 4 through 6). I am looking forward to the best of Here's Lucy but I like Lucy alone with her sidekicks, not with a bunch of guest stars who add nothing to Lucy's brilliance. They certainly don't give her anything to play off of. From the looks of the episodes that have been chosen (I remember this series well as I never missed Lucy), most of the episodes are showcases, not for Ball, but for the guest stars. Only two of these episodes merit 5 stars from me...the "Elizabeth Taylor and Richard Burton" episode and "The Jack Benny" episode. The best moments from Here's Lucy are the one's where she went at it with NO GUEST STARS.....just her, Gale Gordon and the kids. I'm also sad that my favorite "Here's Lucy" episode is not included in this set..."Lucy is N.G. as R.N." a true example of Lucy and her supporting cast going at it alone. It did make a difference in the series. However we have a couple of episodes with Viv in there and that makes the entire set palatable to me. But, please, release the first three seasons of "The Lucy Show"......that's the one I (and many others I am sure) are waiting for!!!! Can anyone out there give a lead as to how to contact Lucie Arnaz and voice our demand for the first three seasons of "The Lucy Show".
summary: I WOULD RATHER HAVE HAD "THE LUCY SHOW"
Title: N/A

reviewText: I'm a 35 y/o dad, who grew up watching I Love Lucy episodes while in N.Y. in the '70's. I remember the Here's Lucy show only because I watched it later on as a teen on cable. I always thought that it just did not live up to Lucy's first show (to be fair few shows do). But I saw this item on Amazon and placed it on my wish list for x-mas, and I will have to say that it was surprisingly good. The episodes that were selected were all incredibly funny and just watching all these stars, some that have unfortunately passed away now, just makes the viewing experience even more nostalgic.The rest of the studios out there should take a good look at this DVD collection, and learn something from it. For starters there are very few shows where ALL the episodes are classics, so why not just compile the best episodes in one box set, like they have done here. I know there are are bunch of hard core fans that want every single episode of a show, but I for one find that sort of ridiculous. Really do you have to have EVERY episode of Seinfeld or Friends for goodness sake, just give us the good stuff on one set and sell the others to those hard core fans. I believe this box set is what a box set should be, the best episodes, commentary, bloopers, behind the scenes and even whole segments of shows where Lucy guest stars for the same stars that appeared on her show. Now that is getting more bang for your buck, if you ask me.Oh and finally, the two episodes where you see Lucy with her old side kick Vivian Vance were just perfect. This really has been a great gift.
summary: Surprisingly Great

reviewText: Here's Lucy - Best Loved Episodesis my favorite DVD set I have..  WOW, this show brings back memories.. It's the first tv show I remember watching... and also loving..  Lucille Ball is timeless, and this DVD brings the late 1960's and early 1970's era right back..  In incredible living color..  Everything looks remarkably vivid, and also the sound is amazing.  I can't get over the amazing picture and sound...  The picture quality is better than any of the DVD tv collections I have.  and Yes the Animated Tap Dancing Lucy at the start of the program is a sight for sore eyes.. It's been too many years since I've gotten to see the lost treasure... This Lucy show is incredible...It looks like you are watching from the front row of the taping.You never see this in syndication.. and that`s a shame since this is LUCY in LIVING COLOR..It's really fun to see all these guest stars...  But, seeing her with her real life children is even BETTER.They are as gifted and talented as their parents...For all you Brady Bunch fans, if you get this box set, you can see Desi Arnaz Jr  at the height of his popularity .. and during the time that he had a guest appearance on the Brady Bunch.  Remember the episode about Marcia's diary.. and she mentioning that somedoay she wanted to be Mrs. Desi Arnaz Jr.Also you can see Eve Plumb (Jan Brady) guest starring with Donny Osmond on this DVD collection.It's too cool..  This show is what we were watching in the late 1960's and also in the 1970's.I hope they will put out all the episodes onto DVD..The extra features are incredible as well.  I really love hearing Lucie and Desi just talking as they watch these episodes... They were so young when they started on this show.
summary: By Far the best DVD SERIES
Title: N/A

reviewText: My first introduction to Lucy was through 'Here's Lucy' on TV after school. I haven't seen the show for years and pre-ordered this DVD before it was released. The box set is excellent, attractive and user friendly. The extras are a joy.  And so many! From bloopers to rehersal footage to commentaries and more. Oh...and one of Gary Morton warming up the audience before the show which was a bit of an embarrassment! The picture is very clear and the sound solid. Just very good qualit y. The whole thing was put together very professionally.The only disappointment was the episodes. 24 episodes in total. A few with the Hollywood guest stars would have been fine. But not nearly every single one! It gets a bit boring seeing Lucy star-struck so often. Lucy played second fiddle and the straight-man in some shows and that isn't what Lucy fans want to see. Basically the episode selection was poor. Could it be possible that Lucie and Desi Jnr put in their favorites? Judging by some of the shows this could be the case, ie. The Generation Gap which was just song and dance and not entertaining and the Donny Osmond one which Lucie Arnaz was in every scene and the Lucy we all wanted to see was in a bit and got two laughs all episode. These and others were hardly the best or most loved.In short a very well constructed DVD release just with poor episode selection. I am not as thrilled with my buy as what I could have been so it is just OK.*This is a review on the DVD and it's contents, not on Lucy or 'Here's Lucy'.
summary: How can a Lucy fan say 'average"?

reviewText: I find that the selection of shows is only mildly entertaining.  I found I Love Lucy to be classic; it has great stories that will never get too dated.  Even in black and white, it still is a fan favorite.  I found The Lucy Show to flow smoothly.  The shows with Vivian were the best, but all of the shows go quickly and are entertaining.  I found only some of the shows on these disks to breeze by.  Other shows seemed to be slow paced and miss the energy Lucy had in her other shows.  As someone said, other episodes should be on this disk that are truly fan favorites.  I would still buy the disk for these episodes:  Lucy Meet the Burtons, With Viv as a Friend, Who needs an Enemy?, Lucy and Lawrence Welk, The Matchmaker,  and the 2 Jack Benny shows.  These shows have classic Lucy routines, warmth and charm.  Some of the others have good moments but then drag on.  The extras are cool though.
summary: Good but not as great as the earlier shows.

reviewText: I've looked forward to the release of "Here's Lucy" for some time now, and last week I learned that the first full season of the series will be released this summer by MPI Home Video. When I purchased the "Best of Here's Lucy" in 2004, my desire to see the series again was driven more by nostalgia than anything else.  The opening credits in my opinion, still rank among the best in television history, but for too many episodes, it's quickly down hill from there. As many have already commented, Lucille Ball missed a good opportunity to bring other dimensions to the "Lucy" character in this 1968-74 vehicle.  In order to fill-out the "Lucy" character, Ms. Ball would need good writers, and this set proves that good writers were in short supply.  Given Ms. Ball's clout in Hollywood, she could have hired writers of the caliber of James L. Brooks, Allan Burns, Carl Reiner, and others.  These writers, and those like them, have the ability to bring the necessary human dimensions to their characters while exploiting the comedy inherent to real-life situations. The plots in many "Here's Lucy" episodes were thinly veiled attempts to accommodate the "big-name" guest star. It seems that the producers of this series worked to secure guest stars, and then the writers had to devise a script around a particular persona.  Creators of well-conceived series understand that the script should drive the casting effort. Then there's the matter of the performances by the cast. First, Lucille Ball needed to stop reading cue cards and return to acting. Then, the actors needed to stop screaming their lines, but delivering them at appropriate levels, after all this was a TV sitcom, not an opera. Unfortunately, at this juncture of her career, age and custom had limited Ms. Ball's desire to develop as a performer, and consequently the ability to develop a series with characters which were believable, stories which were comical, but consistently tethered to some reality to which the audience could relate. For any Lucy fan, this set is worth owning simply because it features the greatest comedienne of all time, and because it showcases a rare product.  Sadly, the "Best of Here's Lucy" is a reminder of why this series is rarely shown.
summary: The Legend could not sustain this series

reviewText: Do you love Lucy?  Do you love Lucille Ball?  Do you like to laugh?  If the answer is even a mild yes to any of those questions, this DVD set is for you!Lucille Ball revolutionized television - well not without help - but as the mastermind behind her first series, her first husband and television co-star, the father of her children, and producer (Desi Arnaz,Sr) said once when she tripped over a cable: "Watch out, boys, if anything happens to her, we're all in the shrimp business!"Her next-to-last regularly scheduled series ("Life With Lucy" on ABC had a VERY short run in the 1980's), "Here's Lucy" ran on CBS from 1968-1974.  It featured Ball as Lucy Carter, the mother of two teenagers Kim (Lucie Arnaz) and Craig (Desi Arnaz, Jr).  Lucy worked for her late husband's brother Harrison Carter (Gale Gordon) at the Unique Employement Agency.Lucie Arnaz has said she doesn't like the way she looks in these episodes, especially her clothes.  Well you can't blame her, but I can tell you, at the time the shows were first aired, she was wearing the "latest" in young girl fashions.  She is a beautiful young lady, but she is not the accomplished performer she would soon become.  However, for me her acting in "Here's Lucy" is VERY comparable to what Deborah Messing is doing on today's "Will & Grace".  Desi Arnaz, Jr, is charming and handsome and not quite ready for the big time. At the time he was a member of a successful rock group Dino (Martin,Jr), Desi, and Billy.  And his current girlfriend Patty Duke is introduced while sitting in the audience during Gary Morton's warmup!With a slight nod to things going on in the world at the time, but mostly an excuse for some surreal guest shots, "Here's Lucy" never reached the sublime heights of "I Love Lucy" or even "The Lucy Show".  But it was a pleasant way to spend a half an hour.  It still is.This DVD set, each episode cleaned up and including six minutes added back to each of the episodes that was trimmed for syndication, presents "Here's Lucy" looking as good if not better than it did in it's original network run (as part of CBS's powerhouse Monday night lineup).  In fact, in a sales promotion tape that is included, Lucie touts the fact that statons stripping the show (showing it five nights in a row in sydication) will receive video tapes of the 35mm masters NOT 16mm reduction prints!Guest stars include Elizabeth Taylor & Richard Burton, Sammy Davis, Jr, Ginger Rogers, Donny Osmond, Lawrence Welk, and Wayne Newton.Oh, the Gary Morton warm up is painful to watch - you have been warned.There are four discs.  Each disc contains six episodes.  They are not in any particular order, but the ones with guest stars outnumber the "ordinary" shows.  And that's too bad, because seeing Lucy react to a star every week was beginning to get boring even toward the end of The Lucy Show!The last episode in the set features Lucy with her frequent co-star Vivian Vance (who also figures in one of the funniest of the bloopers).The extras are plentiful and of GREAT interest.  Comedy is serious business, and we get to see Lucille Ball at work with her crew, her kids, and her guest stars.  The film quality of these bloopers and behind-the-scenes clips is not as crisp as the episodes, but that is to be expected.  Here it is, fans, some Lucy you haven't seen!  There is commentary by Lucie and Desi, Jr, on some of the extras and episodes - and Lucie introduces each show and clip by voice.There is also the Ann-Margret special that featured Lucy and Desi, Jr, in a great number with A-M!Lucy - there was no one like you.  Wonderful to own for nostalgia's sake, or to introduce someone new to Lucy - the kids can watch the episodes and you don't have to worry! (The bloopers of course contain a blue word or two).Hopefully we will get a companion set to this first 24 of the 144 episodes!  I won't quibble about what isn't there (although it includes some of my favorite episodes).  I will just enjoy Lucy!To quote Desi Arnaz, Sr, again:  "I Love Lucy was never just the title of a show...."
summary: Lucy Shines Brightly - Her Kids Less So, but still Fun!!!

reviewText: This is a great DVD set, my only complaint would be the bizarre episode selection. Having said that, the set is superbly made, the picture and sound are remarkable, and that plus the extras make this set well worth the price.  I'd recommend it to Lucy fans.I am awaiting the day, as most Lucy fans are, when "Here's Lucy" and "The Lucy Show" will be released on DVD by season, as this is the way most fans wish to purchase and view the show.  As anyone seen the shockingly AWFUL DVDs of "The Lucy Show"?  Whoever selected THOSE episodes had no love or respect for the show at all, and they look like second or third generation bootlegs.  This Here's Lucy set is a step in the right direction.

reviewText: More great late 60's and early 70's TV.This jogged a few memories for me, as I was very young when these originally aired, but I do remember the show.Especially the intro with the small Lucy Doll, coming out, and being bumped by the spotlight, and then her bumping it back.These are really great quality 4 DVD's that have EXCELLENT color and sound.So many cool guest stars like Flip Wilson, Jack Benny, Sammy Davis, Jr., George Burns, etc.  that serve to really give a historical reference point of some of the things that were going on at the time. (Hippies, Civil Rights movement, etc.)Lucy include her own 2 teenage kids in this also, which again, serves as a good benchmark for the history of the show.I was surprised at how funny I thought this was.  I was expecting it to seem much more corny, but Lucy's slapstick, and silly antics really hold up well. (she likes to dress up, and that's always good for a laugh)It's really like a modern day exit of Vaudeville, and includes a lot of the people that made that era a success.  This is really good Television.
summary: Fun stuff!  Brought back some memories

reviewText: ...and I mean that in the good way. After spending every night with Lucy for a few weeks and getting reacquainted with her later work, I am eagerly awaiting a Best Of Here's Lucy Volume 2. Lucie, Desi Jr. and Shout Factory have all done a commendable job of assembling this--one of the best Classic TV DVD sets I have seen to date! The episodes themselves look pristine, vibrant and sharp, the commentaries are fun and insightful, and the extras such as the Syndication reel and the bloopers are an absolute treat to watch. My only complaint is that 24 episodes are not enough. I hope this set sells like hotcakes so that a follow-up is released quickly. My favorite bits from this set: Lucy's at-home rehearsal of the pickle commercial, Lucy and Carol Burnett competing to be "Secretary Beautiful" and Desi Jr.'s encounter with Ann-Margret! This set is a bargain, so order one today. The minute the little Lucy Claymation figure prances across the screen, you will feel a delicious retro buzz and be instantly transported back to the simpler days of yesteryear~!
summary: This set leaves you wanting more...

reviewText: I actually remember watching Here's Lucy originally when it aired on Monday Nights after Gunsmoke on CBS back in the early 1970's. It was a treat to pick up this set produced by Shout Factory (who also did two excellent You Bet Your Life sets). A number of good episodes on this set, including the Elizabeth Taylor episode, the two Jack Benny ones(especially the episode that had a cameo by Jackie Gleason as Ralph Kramden!), Lucy the Fixer(one of my personal favorites & the episode looks as good as when it first aired!), and the Johhny Carson episode(with echoes of the classic William Holden episode of I Love Lucy). The numerous extras are the topping on the cake. Here's hoping that a Vol 2 will come out, with episodes like Lucy Carter Meets Lucille Ball and the episode where Lucy tries being a nurse.Note: Here's Lucy was originally a new format for The Lucy Show and it was done largely since Desilu was sold to Paramount(Desilu held the rights to I Love Lucy & The Lucy Show). Lucy continued by doing this show with her newly formed production company holding the rights. A lot of episodes of The Lucy Show in the later years had celebrity guests and some of those same guests also did Here's Lucy(examples: Jack Benny and Carol Burnett).
summary: Great presentation of a series not seen in many years!

reviewText: Even though it is not as funny as "I Love Lucy," "Here's Lucy," is a great show.  Lucille Ball is very funny as Lucy Carter, a widow with two teenage kids, played by her real life teens, Lucie Arnaz and Desi Arnaz Jr.  She works as a secretary for her brother-in-law, Harry, played by Gale Gordon.  This boxed set includes some very funny episodes from this series.  Some of the guest stars include, Elizabeth Talor, Johnny Carson, Vivian Vance, Shelly Winters, Jack Benney, Ginger Rogers, and many more.  And the situations are as funny as ever, Lucy goes skydiving, gets Elizabeth Taylor's diamond ring stuck on her finger, and much more.  So, if your a Lucy fan, you'll love her in "Here's Lucy."
summary: Here's Lucy!

reviewText: After reading some of the reviews, I was a bit hesitant to order this set. I'm so glad I went ahead and ordered it anyway! I honestly don't know how anyone could complain about the quality or the show. Both are wonderful.Quality - I am very picky when it comes to the quality of shows. I won't even watch VHS anymore - even if it's the only option I have to watch a show or movie. If it's not on DVD, I don't watch it.The television I'm watching on is a 50" HD plasma. Naturally, with a screen that large, you see every imperfection and it can be quite irritating if the quality is poor.The clarity of this set really surprised me. Beautiful colors and very clear. It's such a pleasure to watch a show that always seems like a bright sunny day.As for whether or not this is Lucy's best work -I'm surprised by how much I'm enjoying the episodes. Oh sure, I grew up watching all of the shows that Lucy did, but it's been quite a while since I've seen this particular show. I'm enjoying every minute of it and think Lucy looks and acts wonderfully.All around, this set was worth every penny. I worry that the people who are being difficult and picking at absolutely everything, are part of the reason why studios aren't releasing as many classic shows as they used to. I am an avid collector of numerous classic shows and am frustrated and disgusted by how many of my favorite shows have only 1 or 2 seasons released and then nothing. That's just not fair to do to consumers.Don't hesitate to buy this set. You will truly enjoy it.
summary: What a surprise!
Title: N/A

reviewText: Although, I had already owned a copy of this DVD, I received it as a Christmas present.  It never hurts to have a spare copy.  I must say that "Here's Lucy" which ran on CBS-TV from 1968-1974 is one of the most underrated sitcoms.  I love this show and it brings back warm memories of Monday night TV.  "Here's Lucy" came on right after "Gunsmoke" and was followed by "Mayberry, R.F.D.," "The Doris Day Show," and "The Carol Burnett Show"; it was a great night of TV.  The DVD set has some of the series' best episodes, i.e., "Lucy Meets the Burtons," "Lucy the Fixer" (which is one of the best of the series), "Lucy and Lawrence Welk" (w/Vivian Vance), "Lucy and Flip Wilson Go Legit," and "Lucy Is Really in a Pickle" (also another favorite of mine).This DVD was really done with loving care and should be released in season sets.  The special features of bloopers and behind the scenes rehearsals are a must see for all Lucy fans.  The DVDs are incredibly crystal clear; you would never think that this show is 40 years old.  The best reason to buy the set is because of Lucy - the one and only Queen of Comedy.  Her comic abilities are just as good as when she starred in "I Love Lucy."  I just loved the whole set and would recommend it to any person who enjoys comedy that is not topical.As I stated before, I wish they would release this show in season sets.  I know that the DVD sold well enough to warrant another release.  I just don't get it, why is it taking so long for another DVD.  The junk that is being released today is just a joke, i.e., "Emergency," "How I Met Your Mother," "Rules of Engagement," and "Arrested Development."I do know that the DVD rights belong to Paramount Home Video and Shout Factory and hope they are smart enough to release season 1 of "Here's Lucy."P.S. I hope CBS and Paramount Home Video release season 1 of "The Lucy Show" (Lucy's second hit TV series).
summary: Here's Lucy - Lucy Shines In Her Third Hit TV Series
Title: N/A

reviewText: Lucille Ball should have stretched her talents in a comedy-variety format. Instead, the immortal redhead dusted off the old routines for "Here's Lucy." Time has not been kind to this 1968-74 sitcom, which finally exhausts the Lucy formula. Though Ball, Gale Gordon, Lucie Arnaz and Desi Arnaz Jr. make a winning ensemble, the scripts and direction are a faint echo of the "I Love Lucy" days. Even the guest spots ring hollow - whether it's Elizabeth Taylor and Richard Burton or Johnny Carson and Ed McMahon. Worse still, Ball's once-sublime physical humor takes on a forced, repetitive quality. Except for a few welcome appearances, Vivian Vance is no longer around to pick up the slack. With its gaudy colors and cheesy sets, "Here's Lucy" looks more dated than "I Love Lucy" ever did. The extras in this DVD collection are better than the actual episodes.
summary: For Lucy Completists

reviewText: Any Lucy fan will want to own this DVD collection, that's for sure.  The episodes speak for themselves, and nothing more need be said about them.  The real pleasure of this DVD collection is the wonderful extras:  bloopers, rehearsal footage, commentaries by Lucie Jr and Desi Jr and of course, the wonderful Carol Burnett and Wayne Newton.  They provide valuable insights into Lucy, and the show.  For years we've heard that Lucy was difficult to work with, very controlling and demanding on the set, and now we have actual rehearsal footage to allow viewers to decide for themselves.  I want to thank the creators of this DVD collection for a product that I'll cherish for years and years.
summary: Thank you for this wonderful collection

reviewText: HERE'S LUCY is the Lucy from "my" era - I grew up watching this show every week but I don't think I have seen it since it was briefly rerun in the mid 1970's.  Lucille Ball has been one of my favorites all my life but I didn't even see an I LOVE LUCY episode until I was a teenager in the late 1970's - and I have rarely stopped watching them since.  I don't know why I put off buying the HERE'S LUCY set, probably because I bought into that "not as good as I Love Lucy" mindset (what the heck WAS??) but I  finally did and boy, have I been enjoying this set!!  Sorry naysayers but HERE'S LUCY is actually REALLY FUNNY.  There are some great laughs in nearly every episode.  The Lucy GONE WITH THE WIND parody with Flip Wilson is just as good as the more famous satire done by Carol Burnett later which is considered one of the great skits in Burnett's career.  A 59-year-old Lucy dances like a top-notch chorine in LUCY AND JACK BENNY'S BIOGRAPHY.  Classic Lucy delirum abounds in LUCY AND LAWRENCE WELK, Lucy on the loose in the two-part Air Force Academy story, and I dare you not to laugh when Lucy forces herself to eat a nasty pickle in LUCY IS REALLY IN A PICKLE, a bit every bit as hilarious as the funniest moments from I Love Lucy.  Vivian Vance and Lucy carry on in three hilarious episodes many years after ILL like it was the next day, and Mary Jane Croft is around in several to be a most acceptable second banana.  Gale Gordon is far more appealing here as the kinder Uncle Harry than he was as the bombastic Mr. Mooney from THE LUCY SHOW.  Lucie Arnaz and Desi Arnaz Jr, while only teenagers, do very well indeed and bring a nice "family" touch to the stories.And the extras!!! Awesome!!! Priceless footage showing Lucy's dedication to her work rehearsing, hilarious bloopers with Jack Benny and Bob Hope, and a phenomeonally great musical number with Ann-Margret from a TV special with Lucy and Ann as the world's most starstruck celebrities which shows Lucy was a darn good singer when the material was right for her.Please ignore the negative comments, I wouldn't be surprised if most of them are from people who haven't even viewed this set.  This set is a fine companion to the classic I LOVE LUCY DVD sets and I loved it every bit as much as those.  PLEASE Shout Factory give us a "Volume Two" very soon!!!  And if you want to start releasing this show by the season, I will happily buy those too!!!
summary: I Love (Here's) Lucy!!!!
Title: N/A

reviewText: I was lucky enough to get this for $9.99 on Amazon's Marketplace, but this DVD set would have been worth any price.  It's Lucille Ball afterall, and the shows -- shot on film -- are sharp and crystal clear with new prints that are truly colorful. Somebody deserves a round of applause for the best DVD release of the year.I think the best part of this DVD set are the almost 2 hours or so of bonus material.  It is great watching "The Ball" at rehearsal and it shows just how much a professional she was at every aspect of the business. I walked away with more respect than I've ever had of the greatest comedienne of all time (Marie Osmond a close second -- j.k.).The DVD set is well-packaged and opens up like some kind of small treasure you've discovered for yourself.  Don't hesitate to get this if it is something you've been wanting.  I had rented the DVDs from Netflix a couple of years earlier but am glad I bought the set for myself.
summary: Wonderful Wonderful
Title: N/A

reviewText: The show itself was okay; I loved the opening credits with the marionette. And the video quality looks good IF you watch it on a regular TV and DVD player. However, I just watched it on an LCD HDTV with an upconverting to hi-def DVD player, and I can tell you these episodes were transferred from analog videotape and NOT digitally remastered. This is not the correct way to release this, as it was shot on film and should have been digitally remastered from those original films. That step was skipped to save time and money. I understand why they did it, but it's a bad way to release something in the digital mode. On the plus side, this show has its funny moments (even if it relies way too heavily on celebrity guest stars) and this is a much-loved series to people who watched it as kids. I'm glad it's available, and while the quality's not bad, it could be better by not making the transfers from videotapes, especially analog.
summary: Mastered from analog videotape
Title: N/A

reviewText: I've only been through Disc 1 and that disc alone is a treasure trove.Naturally, the most famous HERE'S LUCY episode is included, where Lucy encounters Richard Burton and Elizabeth Taylor and ends up getting Elizabeth's huge diamond ring stuck on her finger. Other episodes include guest appearances by Jack Benny, Carol Burnett, Sammy Davis Jr., Shelley Winters, Helen Hayes, among others. One hilarious episode with just the regular cast, including Gale Gordon, Lucie Arnaz and Desi Arnaz, Jr., has Lucy destroying Harry's house looking for some loose wires.DVD remastering is superb with great commentary by Lucie, Desi Jr and Carol Burnett on selected episodes. Picture clarity is the best I've seen and "stereo" sound for a TV series of that era. Also includes Blooper reels of outtakes, mistakes, rehearsals of actual shows with some "surprise" visitors to the set, and spots from Lucy guest appearances on other specials with guest stars that appeared on her show.My disappointment was Best Buy and Target "not" having it on day of release and Barnes & Noble having "one" that I grabbed, even at full price. This is shocking for anything "Lucy" for fans that want to go to the store. Are some retailers forgetting who she was?If you get it, ENJOY!To one of the reviewers above....YES....both LUCY THE FIXIT and LUCY AND LAWRENCE WELK, with VIVIAN VANCE are included in this set!  I'm sorry that the CHUCK CONNORS episode, as well as MY FAIR BUZZI didn't make the cut.
summary: 3RD SERIES SHINES BEAUTIFULY IN DIGITAL
Title: N/A

reviewText: Some may quarrel over this issue of releasing a "best of" set, as opposed to a season set. In this case, I think the "best of" format serves the purpose best. While this show, during it's run, had some great moments and some dull ones, the dull ones are few and far between on this set. This is a cavalcade of old stars, from when Hollywood stardom meant class and talent....Richard Burton, Milton Berle, Jack Benny, Bob Hope, Johnny Carson, Ann-Margret, and George Burns, just to name a few. (The episode with Lawrence Welk hamming it up is a howl.) Only when the guest stars disappear does this show hit the skids. "Here's Lucy" was best when it played out as a skit, similar to "The Carol Burnett Show".It's great to see these true stars, and the transfers are wonderfully done by Shout. Not only that, the extras are outstanding as well. Commercials, promos, rehearsal tapes, outtakes...you name it, it's there.If you are in the least bit interested in truly funny bits, and stars of the golden age of hollywood, this is a must have.
summary: This is how a series DVD set SHOULD be done
